00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the CN7XXX hardware BCH engine.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 79788 $<hr>
00046  */

00049 #define __CVMX_BCH_H__

00053 # include <asm/octeon/cvmx-bch-defs.h>
00054 # include <asm/octeon/cvmx-fpa.h>
00055 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT)
00056 # include <common.h>
00057 # include <asm/arch/cvmx.h>

00059 # include <asm/arch/cvmx-fpa.h>

00070 
00071 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00072 #define CVMX_BCH_DRBELL CVMX_BCH_DRBELL_FUNC()
00073 static inline uint64_t CVMX_BCH_DRBELL_FUNC(void)
00074 {
00075     if (!OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) &&
00076         !OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) &&
00077         !OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00078         cvmx_warn("CVMX_BCH_DRBELL not supported on this chip\n");
00079     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001710000000000ull);
00080 }
00081 #else
00082 #define CVMX_BCH_DRBELL (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001710000000000ull))
00083 #endif
00084 
00085 union cvmx_bch_drbell {
00086     uint64_t u64;
00087     struct cvmx_bch_drbell_s {
00088 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00089         uint64_t reserved_20_63 : 44;
00090         uint64_t cnt        : 20;   /**
00091         * Number of 64-bit words to add
00092         * to the BCH instruction
00093         * doorbell count.  BCH
00094         * instructions are from 4 to 36
00095         * words.
00096         */
00097 #else
00098         uint64_t cnt        : 20;   /**
00099         * Number of 64-bit words to add
00100         * to the BCH instruction
00101         * doorbell count.  BCH
00102         * instructions are from 4 to 36
00103         * words.
00104         */
00105         uint64_t reserved_20_63 : 44;
00106 #endif
00107     } s;
00108     struct cvmx_bch_drbell_s    cn70xx;
00109 };
00110 typedef union cvmx_bch_drbell cvmx_bch_drbell_t;
00111 
00112 typedef enum {
00113     CVMX_BCH_INST_BLOCK_CORRECTION  = 0,    /** Perform block correction */
00114     CVMX_BCH_INST_ECC_GENERATION    = 1,    /** Generate ECC data */
00115 } cvmx_bch_inst_type_t;
00116 
00117 typedef union cvmx_bch_command {
00118     uint64_t u64[4];
00119     struct fields {
00120         /** CWORD Format */
00121         struct _cword {
00122 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00123             uint64_t    ecc_gen:1;  /** See cvmx_bch_inst_type_t */
00124             uint64_t    reserved1:24;   /** Must be zero */
00125             /**
00126              * Maximum number of errors that can be corrected.  The number
00127              * of parity bytes is equal to ((15 * ecc_level) + 7) / 8.
00128              * ecc_level must be 4, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 60 or 64.
00129              */
00130             uint64_t    ecc_level:7;
00131             uint64_t    reserved2:20;   /** Must be zero */
00132             /** Size in bytes of data block.  Must be multiple of 2 */
00133             uint64_t    size:12;
00134 #else
00135             uint64_t    size:12;
00136             uint64_t    reserved1:20;
00137             uint64_t    ecc_level:7;
00138             uint64_t    reserved2:24;
00139             uint64_t    ecc_gen:1;
00140 #endif
00141         } cword;
00142         /** OWORD Format */
00143         struct _oword {
00144 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00145             uint64_t    reserved1:6;    /** Must be zero */
00146             /**
00147              * BCH can modify any byte in any 128-byte cache line
00148              * touched by L2/DRAM addresses oword.ptr through
00149              * oword.ptr + cword.size - 1.  Setting this to 1 can
00150              * improve hardware performance as some DRAM load
00151              * operations can be avoided on L2 cache misses.
00152              */
00153             uint64_t    fw:1;
00154             /**
00155              * When set indicates that BCH should not allocate L2
00156              * cache space for the parity correction data on L2
00157              * misses.
00158              */
00159             uint64_t    nc:1;
00160             uint64_t    reserved2:16;   /** Must be zero */
00161             /**
00162              * Starting address of L2/DRAM buffer.  When ecc_gen is
00163              * CVMX_BCH_INST_BLOCK_CORRECTION this contains the
00164              * address where the corrected data shall be placed,
00165              * otherwise this contains the address of the generated
00166              * ecc data.
00167              *
00168              * ptr must be naturally-aligned on an 8-byte boundary.
00169              */
00170             uint64_t    ptr:40;
00171 #else
00172             uint64_t    ptr:40;
00173             uint64_t    reserved1:16;
00174             uint64_t    nc:1;
00175             uint64_t    fw:1;
00176             uint64_t    reserved2:6;
00177 #endif
00178         } oword;
00179         /** IWORD Format */
00180         struct _iword {
00181 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00182             uint64_t    reserved1:7;    /** Must be zero */
00183             /**
00184              * When set do not allocate L2 cache space for the input
00185              * data on L2 cache misses.
00186              */
00187             uint64_t    nc:1;
00188             uint64_t    reserved2:16;   /** Must be zero */
00189             /**
00190              * Starting address of input data in L2/DRAM.
00191              *
00192              * When ecc_gen is CVMX_BCH_INST_BLOCK_CORRECTION this
00193              * contains the address where the ecc data is located,
00194              * otherwwise this contains the address of the data
00195              * block.
00196              *
00197              * ptr must be naturally-aligned on an 8-byte boundary.
00198              */
00199             uint64_t    ptr:40;
00200 #else
00201             uint64_t    ptr:40;
00202             uint64_t    reserved1:16;
00203             uint64_t    nc:1;
00204             uint64_t    reserved2:7;
00205 #endif
00206         } iword;
00207         /** RESP Format */
00208         struct _resp {
00209 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00210             uint64_t    reserved:24;    /** Must be zero */
00211             /**
00212              * Pointer where two byte operation status will be
00213              * written
00214              */
00215             uint64_t    ptr:40;
00216 #else
00217             uint64_t    ptr:40;
00218             uint64_t    reserved:24;
00219 #endif
00220         } resp;
00221     } s;
00222 } cvmx_bch_command_t;
00223 
00224 /** Response from BCH instruction */
00225 union cvmx_bch_response {
00226     uint16_t  u16;
00227     struct cvmx_bch_response_s {
00228 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00229         uint16_t    done:1;     /** Block is done */
00230         uint16_t    uncorrectable:1;/** Block could not be corrected */
00231         uint16_t    erased:1;   /** Block is erased */
00232         uint16_t    zero:6;     /** Always zero, ignore */
00233         uint16_t    num_errors:7;   /** Number of errors in block */
00234 #else
00235         uint16_t    num_errors:7;   /** Number of errors in block */
00236         uint16_t    zero:6;     /** Always zero, ignore */
00237         uint16_t    erased:1;   /** Block is erased */
00238         uint16_t    uncorrectable:1;/** Block could not be corrected */
00239         uint16_t    done:1;     /** Block is done */
00240 #endif
00241     } s;
00242 };
00243 typedef union cvmx_bch_response cvmx_bch_response_t;
00244 
00245 /**
00246  * Sets up the BCH configuration data
00247  * (only FPA pool for now)
00248  */
00249 typedef struct {
00250     cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t  command_queue_pool; /** BCH FPA pool */
00251     int         aura;
00252 } cvmx_bch_app_config_t;
00253 
00254 extern CVMX_SHARED cvmx_bch_app_config_t bch_config;
00255 
00256 /**
00257  * Gets the pool number used by BCH
00258  *
00259  * @return FPA pool number used
00260  */
00261 static inline int64_t cvmx_fpa_get_bch_pool(void)
00262 {
00263     return bch_config.command_queue_pool.pool_num;
00264 }
00265 
00266 /**
00267  * Gets the size of the buffer in BCH FPA pool
00268  *
00269  * @return FPA pool buffer size
00270  */
00271 static inline uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_bch_pool_block_size(void)
00272 {
00273     return bch_config.command_queue_pool.buffer_size;
00274 }
00275 
00276 /**
00277  * Gets the buffer count of the BCH pool
00278  *
00279  * @return buffer count of BCH FPA pool
00280  */
00281 static inline uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_bch_pool_buffer_count(void)
00282 {
00283     return bch_config.command_queue_pool.buffer_count;
00284 }
00285 
00286 /**
00287  * Ring the BCH doorbell telling it that new commands are
00288  * available.
00289  *
00290  * @param num_commands  Number of new commands
00291  */
00292 static inline void cvmx_bch_write_doorbell(uint64_t num_commands)
00293 {
00294     uint64_t num_words =
00295         num_commands * sizeof(cvmx_bch_command_t) / sizeof(uint64_t);
00296     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00297     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_BCH_DRBELL, num_words);
00298 }
00299 
00300 /**
00301  * Sets the internal FPA pool data structure for bch pool.
00302  * @param pool  fpa pool number to use
00303  * @param buffer_size   buffer size of pool
00304  * @param buffer_count  number of buffers to allocate to pool
00305  */
00306 void cvmx_bch_set_cmd_que_pool_config(int64_t pool, uint64_t buffer_size,
00307                       uint64_t buffer_count);
00308 
00309 /**
00310  * Gets the FPA pool data from internal data structure
00311  * @param bch_pool pointer to the fpa data structure to copy data
00312  */
00313 void cvmx_bch_get_cmd_que_pool_config(cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t *bch_pool);
00314 
00315 /**
00316  * Initializes the BCH hardware before use.
00317  * @return 0 on success, -1 on failure
00318  */
00319 int cvmx_bch_initialize(void);
00320 
00321 /**
00322  * Shutdown and cleanup resources used by the BCH
00323  */
00324 int cvmx_bch_shutdown(void);
00325 
00326 /**
00327  * Given a data block calculate the ecc data and fill in the response
00328  *
00329  * @param[in] block 8-byte aligned pointer to data block to calculate ECC
00330  * @param block_size    Size of block in bytes, must be a multiple of two.
00331  * @param ecc_level Number of errors that must be corrected.  The number of
00332  *          parity bytes is equal to ((15 * ecc_level) + 7) / 8.
00333  *          Must be 4, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 60 or 64.
00334  * @param[out] ecc  8-byte aligned pointer to where ecc data should go
00335  * @param[in] response  pointer to where responses will be written.
00336  *
00337  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00338  */
00339 int cvmx_bch_encode(const void *block, uint16_t block_size,
00340             uint8_t ecc_level, void *ecc,
00341             volatile cvmx_bch_response_t *response);
00342 
00343 /**
00344  * Given a data block and ecc data correct the data block
00345  *
00346  * @param[in] block_ecc_in  8-byte aligned pointer to data block with ECC
00347  *              data concatenated to the end to correct
00348  * @param block_size        Size of block in bytes, must be a multiple of
00349  *              two.
00350  * @param ecc_level     Number of errors that must be corrected.  The
00351  *              number of parity bytes is equal to
00352  *              ((15 * ecc_level) + 7) / 8.
00353  *              Must be 4, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 60 or 64.
00354  * @param[out] block_out    8-byte aligned pointer to corrected data buffer.
00355  *              This should not be the same as block_ecc_in.
00356  * @param[in] response      pointer to where responses will be written.
00357  *
00358  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00359  */
00360 int cvmx_bch_decode(const void *block_ecc_in, uint16_t block_size,
00361             uint8_t ecc_level, volatile void *block_out,
00362             volatile cvmx_bch_response_t *response);
00363
